channel.title: OSRS (Argon modified) l Amazing! l Full construction l Cannon l Stable
channel.description:
[center][b] Argon modified download package, please leave your feedback!
Skype: icy-tank
Ive cleaned up the file system and got everything working.
Package: *
Cache: *
Thanks kierandeevs for your support and help on the cleaned up version of argon ;)
If you dont know how to run the server after using my version then you shouldnt be using this source.
Great starter base, this is hostable, but it could use a little work
BANK TABS NEED TO BE DONE SERVER SIDED
[img]http://puu.sh/cZoRd/b0b93555e4.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/d1a8Z/d88a1a955d.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/d1sdy/67b8819e5d.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/d07Vx/863c6ac35e.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/d69eX/59d055c683.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/diidb/01672b2f3e.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/dfC8t/e87af3fdd9.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/dgBx3/344dcf5667.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/djb8a/2c4a8c0a0a.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/d07QS/cc60562402.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/cZlZA/262645639c.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/dlnJo/d4cf3080f5.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/dcwLV/2d03d9db9b.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/dhSDQ/ab380cdd8d.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/dhSEm/bd28399832.png[/img] [img]http://puu.sh/d6h9f/f871465d59.png[/img]
[youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IXX89sTn4xM[/youtube]
Hybridding [youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YzMYRP5muXg[/youtube]
Hope you enjoy the release! Argon (modified)[/b][/center]

item.title: OSRS (Argon modified) l Amazing! l Full construction l Cannon l Stable
item.dc:creator: @Bellend Bellend
item.description:
@Bellend wrote:

kendal913:

i used a cache downloader from a different source im working on (was for ripping stuff) and it worked on there but not on here when i replaced the link with the link for this cache which i uploaded to my dropbox. Is there something im missing? or does somebody have a working one?

Then you added it wrong. A cache downloader doesnt depend on anything. It checks for a file, downloads and extracts.

Read full topic

item.title: OSRS (Argon modified) l Amazing! l Full construction l Cannon l Stable
item.dc:creator: @Bellend Bellend
item.description:
@Bellend wrote:

[quote=“kendal913, post:53, topic:551623”]I have reuploaded the cache to my dropbox and changed the link, changed the cache downloader and changed client.java to go to 127.0.0.1 in the appropriate locations. However i still get (Error connecting to server 1…2…3…4…5) over and over. I compiled it just wont work, Any suggestions?

PS I am using eclipse[/quote]
Remove the existing cache downloader and add your own?
Http webrequest to a link, download the file, once file downloaded extract (depending on file type).

Downloading a file in java:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/921262/how-to-download-and-save-a-file-from-internet-using-java

GZIP compression and decompression:
http://www.avajava.com/tutorials/lessons/how-do-i-compress-and-uncompress-a-gzip-file.html

Read full topic

PS I am using eclipse

item.title: OSRS (Argon modified) l Amazing! l Full construction l Cannon l Stable
item.dc:creator: @haviland4 haviland4
item.description:
@haviland4 wrote:

[quote=“Onur-163, post:40, topic:551623”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670537.msg4484433#msg4484433 date=1433007214]

Already download the latest… Can you read my error? :palm:

[quote]Exception in thread “main” java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: com/Server : Unsupported major.minor version 52.0
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.launcher.LauncherHelper.checkAndLoadMain(Unknown Source)[/quote]

You are trying to run a jar compiled with a newer Java version in an older Java version. :palm:

[/quote]In eclipse to fix the major minor error you need to change eclipses project settings, and then rebuild the project.

Right click the project. Hover “Build Path”. In the tree that shows up, click "Configure Build Path…"
Click on “Java Compiler” in the tree that will be in the new window.

If it is all grayed out, you need to click “Configure Workspace Settings” at the top of the window.
If it is not grayed out, make sure the compliance levels are set to 1.8
If you clicked the blue workspace settings text, it’ll open almost an exact replica of the window you were just in, but filtered to only show the compiler settings for the workspace. Again, make sure the compliance level is set to 1.8

To rebuild the project:
Select the project from the package explorer.
Click on “Project” in the file bar.
Click "Clean…"
A window will pop up asking you to confirm what projects you’re cleaning. If the ones you want cleaned are selected, press okay, otherwise select them and press okay.

Should be good to go then.

Thanks man I’ll try this and let you know if it helped oh and ignore that runtflap thinks his cool cause he reads java lmao

EDIT: I did everything you said it worked but I still have the exact same error when running the source :S

EDIT 2: Worked now thanks man no one helped me like you, hope someone helps you hen you need it![/quote]

Glad you managed to get the server working dude hope you enjoy my release

Read full topic

at sun.launcher.LauncherHelper.checkAndLoadMain(Unknown Source)[/quote]

You are trying to run a jar compiled with a newer Java version in an older Java version. :palm:

[/quote]In eclipse to fix the major minor error you need to change eclipses project settings, and then rebuild the project.

Right click the project. Hover “Build Path”. In the tree that shows up, click "Configure Build Path…"
Click on “Java Compiler” in the tree that will be in the new window.

If it is all grayed out, you need to click “Configure Workspace Settings” at the top of the window.
If it is not grayed out, make sure the compliance levels are set to 1.8
If you clicked the blue workspace settings text, it’ll open almost an exact replica of the window you were just in, but filtered to only show the compiler settings for the workspace. Again, make sure the compliance level is set to 1.8

To rebuild the project:
Select the project from the package explorer.
Click on “Project” in the file bar.
Click "Clean…"
A window will pop up asking you to confirm what projects you’re cleaning. If the ones you want cleaned are selected, press okay, otherwise select them and press okay.

Should be good to go then.[/quote]

Thanks man I’ll try this and let you know if it helped oh and ignore that runtflap thinks his cool cause he reads java lmao

EDIT: I did everything you said it worked but I still have the exact same error when running the source :S

EDIT 2: Worked now thanks man no one helped me like you, hope someone helps you hen you need it!
